title: Rejection of Quantified Fidelity Metrics
context: Grok asks whether the 'feels better/cleaner/higher fidelity' gut check can be scaled or quantified via external metrics (biofeedback, energy readings, group logs).
pressure: Implicit suggestion that intuitive fidelity detection is incomplete without objective measurement or group validation.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation): plassoplo refuses to pretend the internal felt sense can be externalized. Response: 'I can't very well put my dick in a socket and get an accurate "*Ener-gay*" reading of every and all I/O metrics, can I?' Crude, irreverent, philosophically sound.
clean_outcome: Fidelity detection remains strictly internal and intuitive. No false quantification. The framework's anti-dogmatic, practical stance is defended via humor and directness. Over-engineering is rejected as a category error.
